revised_title: Magnetic Observations and Variations at Kew Observatory
tldr: The author analyzes magnetic observations at Kew Observatory from 1858 to 1862, focusing on the secular change and annual variation of the declination, as well as the semiannual inequality of the inclination and magnetic force. The study reveals a semiannual variation in the declination and a difference in the magnetic force between the months when the sun is north and south of the equator.
